Your compatriots are rounding up the few who remain, taking them captive and preparing for a sacrifice like none ever seen. You pray for [[a noble death|The End]].<br> <br> <</switch>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<if $role is "Cortes">> Much to your dismay, your fears turn out to be valid. As you near Tlaxcala, <<print $Tlax_Leader>> informs you that he and his men will not be carrying on the rest of the way. They will remain in Tlaxcala, leaving you to face the enemy with a greatly-diminished force.<br> <br> This news comes as a terrible blow. The odds are no longer in your favor.<br> <br> You spend the night in Tlaxcala and lie awake all night weighing your next move. Will you try to catch Velazquez' men off guard in a sneak attack or is it safer to negotiate an agreement?<br> <br> Think carefully about this decision. You have been away for many moons, a stranger in a foreign land. It is now time to tell Cortes that you will not be at his side when he meets his enemy at the coast. <br> <br> Cortes takes the news with a steely glare and it is clear that he is not happy with the news. With the loss of your men, his forces are greatly diminished. But this is not your battle to fight.<br> <br> You host the troops for the night and see them on their way the next morning, [[content to remain where you are|Tlaxcalans Back In Tlaxcala]].<br> <br> <</if>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<switch $users[$role]["faction"]>> <<case "Spaniards">> <b>YOU'VE BEEN ATTACKED!!!!</b><br> <br> The Tlaxcalans have decided to take the offensive and launch an attack! The Spanish force is small, but they carry powerful weapons and they ride their giant deer.<br> <br> This is your final opportunity to weigh your options before you reach the point of no return. Go to the Tlaxcalan discussion board and decide on your best course of action. <br> <br> Option 1: This is your best chance to defeat the Aztecs. You've waited years for this opportunity and you're not about to let it slip away from you now! You will carry on to the city.<br> <br> Option 2: You have serious doubts about the Spaniards in your camp. Recent events have led you to wonder if they might be a more immediate threat than your Aztec enemies. You send a messenger to Tenochtitlán to negotiate an alliance.<br> <br> Option 3: You have serious doubts about the Spaniards in your camp. You wonder if they're leading you into a losing battle with the hated Aztecs. You decide to cut your losses. You leave the Spaniards to their fate and head for home.<br> <br> Option 4: You have long doubted the Spaniards in your camp and already made a secret alliance with the Aztecs. Cortes warns you of the force that you will likely encounter. They will be men like his own, but they will carry even more weapons. He calls them cannons and prepares you to face them once again.<br> <br> As you make your way to the coast, you and your compatriots discuss your options. Will you fight for Cortes, as he has asked? Is it worth it? What might you gain if you do?<br> <br> Go to the Tlaxcalan board and discuss the following options:<br> <br> <b>Option 1:</b> You agree to go to battle with Cortes.<br> <b>Option 2:</b> You will not go to battle with Cortes and you will tell him this before you reach Tlaxcala, so that you might leave the war party and go home.<br> <b>Option 3:</b> You will not go to battle with Cortes, but you decide not to tell him. If only you had eyes on the coast, you might be better able to prepare.<br> <br> Head to the Tlaxcalan discussion board to discuss whether there's anything you can do to prepare for the unknown.<br> <br> When you have made your plan, <<link "click here to continue" "A Tlaxcalan Nap">><<set $TL_Attacks="No">><</link>>.<br> <br> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<if $role is "Cortes">> You have received word that the enemy camp lies just ahead. You decide that the best course of action is not to confront the enemy head on, but to take them by surprise in a sneak attack. <br> <br> You wait until midnight to launch your attack, hoping to catch the enemy forces asleep. You give the command to attack and charge the Spanish camp, but you are missing some of your men! As the enemy forces collect themselves and gather their weapons to fight back, you realize that none of your Tlaxcalan allies are with you. Have you been betrayed? <br> <br> You don't have long to dwell on this fact, for the battle quickly turns against you. You fight for your life, but to no avail. As you feel the strike of the final blow, you fall to your knees and wonder why <<link "God has forsaken you" "The End">><<set $users["Cortes"]["stats"]["Strength"]=0>><<set $users["Cortes"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]=0>><<set $users["Cortes"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]=0>><<set $Cortes_Dead="Yes">><</link>><br> <br> <<else>> You have received word that the enemy camp lies just ahead. The time has come to execute your plan.<br> <br> As you approach the camp, Cortes proposes a plan of his own: rather than meet his enemies head on, he wants to catch them off guard in a surprise attack. You agree that this is the best chance for success and wait patiently for nightfall.<br> <br> At midnight, Cortes makes the signal to attack, hoping to catch the enemy forces asleep. Rather than spring into action, you make your retreat. This is not your battle to fight and Cortes is not your friend. You make your way towards Tlaxcala with [[the sound of cannon fire ringing in your ears|Tlaxcalans Back In Tlaxcala]].<br> <br> <</if>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> You have decided that it's best to remain patient. You will leave both groups to carry on their journeys undisturbed, watching carefully and waiting for your opening.<br> <br> You <<link "head back to Tlaxcala" "The Spaniards Head Inland">><<set $users["Xicotencatl_Elder"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+1>><<set $users["Xicotencatl_Younger"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+1>><<set $users["Maxixcatl"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+1>><</link>> wondering what the future holds.<br> <br> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<set _Mutiny_Voted = setup.getTotalChoices("Mutiny_Voted")>> <<if _Mutiny_Voted <3>> All is quiet in Tlaxcala and you find yourself bored, wondering what could possibly be happening on the coast. Unfortunately, your decision not to send spies means that you've lost track of the foreigners and have no idea what's going on.<br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"><br> <br> <<print _Mutiny_Voted>> players have voted.<br> <br> <<elseif _Mutiny_Voted >=3 and $Mut_Cor >=2>> You wait anxiously for news from the coast. Clearly [[things are happening|Tlaxcalans keep waiting]]!<br> <br> <</if>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<switch $role>> <<case "Cortes">> After your encounter with the Mexica, the mood amongst your men has shifted. There is excitement about the riches that may well lie inland, but there is also a clear current of unease. You have heard whispers that the men have doubts about your leadership and that one of your crew may be even be planning a mutiny. <br> <br> You must convince your men to remain loyal. Only you can lead them to the gold and the glory that await them! You may want to address them as a group, but it might be more effective to win over each individually. Choose your best course of action and go to Discord to make your case.<br> <br> When you are satisfied with your effort [[you may continue on|Cortes decides to beach ships]].<br> <br> <<case "Olid">> After your encounter with the Mexica, the mood amongst the men has shifted. There is excitement about the riches that may well lie inland, but there is also a clear current of unease. You've always questioned Cortés' abilities and his betrayal of your friend Velazquez left a bitter taste in your mouth. Like Cortés, you are convinced that the journey inland could bring you untold riches, but you do not have faith in his leadership. Besides, whoever leads the expedition will surely be rewarded by the King. Now is your chance to take that victory for yourself!<br> <br> You must convince the others that you will make a better leader than Cortés. Go to Discord and convince them to mutiny. It is of the utmost importance that Cortés not find out, however, so be discrete in your interactions. You don't want to get caught!<br> <br> Once you have done all you can to convince your teammates, continue [[to the next screen to find out if you have succeeded|Mutiny Outcome]]. <br> <br> <<case "Alvarado" or "Aguilar" or "Garrido">> After your encounter with the Mexica, the mood amongst the crew has shifted. There is excitement about the riches that may well lie inland, but there is also a clear current of unease. Cortés thinks you should forge inland, in search of the Aztec capital and the riches that surely await you, but do you trust him to lead you there? There is at least one among you who lacks faith in Cortés.<br> <br> Go to the discussion board to see what is being said. Is Cortés able to maintain your support? Or can you be convinced to change your allegiance? You may be approached in private, so keep an eye on your DMs.<br> <br> Once you have decided where your loyalty lies, [[continue to the next screen|Spaniards decide whether to mutiny]].<br> <br> <<case "Marina">> After your encounter with the Mexica, the mood amongst the men has shifted. There is excitement about the riches that may well lie inland, but there is also a clear current of unease. You have learned a great deal about your companions during these last weeks and it seems there is deep distrust among them.<br> <br> Go to Discord to see what is being said. Will you support Cortés? Or would you rather place your trust in someone else? You may be approached in private, so keep an eye on your DMs. If the men do not yet perceive you as a member of the team, now might be a good time to prove your allegiance.<br> <br> Once you have decided where your loyalty lies, [[continue to the next screen|Spaniards decide whether to mutiny]].<br> <br> <</switch>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<switch $users[$role]["faction"]>> <<case "Spaniards">> <<if $role is "Marina">> Cortes and your Tlaxcalan friends have been gone for over three weeks, but life goes on in Tenochtitlán. <<print $Aztec_Leader>> has granted permission for an elaborate celebration to be held, the festival of Toxcatl, which will honor the God Huitzilopochtli. For days now, the city has been bustling with energy as the residents prepare.<br> <br> The festival will begin today and the final preparation last night was the installation of an elaborate sculpture of Huitzilopochtli in front of the Templo Mayor. The sculpture is moulded from the ground seeds of the chicolote, a medicinal plant, and adorned in the finest of feathers. It is a remarkable piece of workmanship. You look on as a parade of warriors pass in single file before the God, making offerings of food. <br> <br> The drums begin to sound and the greatest warriors in the Aztec Empire start to dance. You find yourself mesmerized. As the music reaches a fever pitch, chaos unfolds around you. The Spaniards are attacking the warriors, who have been caught off guard. They cut down the bulk of the mighty Aztec Army in a single blow.<br> <br> As the dust settles, people flood into the plaza and you feel yourself surrounded. You join your companions as they flee the plaza and [[head for the palace|Aztec Leader taken prisoner]].<br> <br> <<else>> Cortes and your Tlaxcalan friends have been gone for over three weeks, but life goes on in Tenochtitlán. <<print $Aztec_Leader>> has granted permission for an elaborate celebration to be held, the festival of Toxcatl, which will honor the God Huitzilopochtli. For days now, the city has been bustling with energy as the residents prepare.<br> <br> The festival will begin today and the final preparation last night was the installation of an elaborate sculpture of Huitzilopochtli in front of the Templo Mayor. The sculpture is moulded from the ground seeds of the chicolote, a medicinal plant, and adorned in the finest of feathers. You've never seen anything like it. You look on as a parade of warriors pass in single file before the God, making offerings of food. <br> <br> The drums begin to sound and the greatest warriors in the Aztec Empire start to dance. You find yourself mesmerized. As the music reaches a fever pitch, chaos unfolds around you. Your men are attacking the warriors, who have been caught off guard. You cut down the bulk of the mighty Aztec Army in a single blow.<br> <br> As the dust settles, people flood into the plaza and you feel yourself surrounded. You flee the plaza and [[head for the palace|Aztec Leader taken prisoner]].<br> <br> <</if>> <<case "Aztecs">> <<if $Aztec_Leader is $role>> Cortes took his Tlaxcalan allies to the coast three weeks past, but left a large contingent of men behind. It's clear that the people of Tenochtitlán are wary of their presence. Nonetheless, life must go on. You have granted permission for an elaborate celebration to be held, the festival of Toxcatl, which will honor the God Huitzilopochtli. For days now, the city has been bustling with energy as everyone prepares.<br> <br> The festival will begin today and the final preparation last night was the installation of an elaborate sculpture of Huitzilopochtli in front of the Templo Mayor. The sculpture is moulded from the ground seeds of the chicolote, a medicinal plant, and adorned in the finest of feathers. You gaze proudly upon this magnificent tribute to your God. You look on as a parade of warriors pass in single file before him, making offerings of food. <br> <br> The drums begin to sound and the greatest warriors in the Aztec Empire start to dance. You watch, mesmerized. As the music reaches a fever pitch, chaos unfolds around you. The Spaniards are attacking the warriors, who have been caught off guard! They cut down the bulk of the mighty Aztec Army in a single blow.<br> <br> Horrified at this turn of events, [[you quickly slip back to the palace|Aztec Leader taken prisoner]]. It is up to you to deal with the enemies in your midst.<br> <br> <<else>> Cortes took his Tlaxcalan allies to the coast three weeks past, but left a large contingent of men behind. It's clear that the people of Tenochtitlán are wary of their presence. Nonetheless, life must go on. <<print $Aztec_Leader>> has granted permission for an elaborate celebration to be held, the festival of Toxcatl, which will honor the God Huitzilopochtli. For days now, the city has been bustling with energy as everyone prepares.<br> <br> The festival will begin today and the final preparation last night was the installation of an elaborate sculpture of Huitzilopochtli in front of the Templo Mayor. The sculpture is moulded from the ground seeds of the chicolote, a medicinal plant, and adorned in the finest of feathers. You gaze proudly upon this magnificent tribute to your God. You look on as a parade of warriors pass in single file before him, making offerings of food. <br> <br> The drums begin to sound and the greatest warriors in the Aztec Empire start to dance. You watch, mesmerized. As the music reaches a fever pitch, chaos unfolds around you. The Spaniards are attacking the warriors, who have been caught off guard! They cut down the bulk of the mighty Aztec Army in a single blow.<br> <br> As the dust settles, people flood into the plaza. You join the mob in an attempt to hunt down the Spaniards, who have [[fled toward the palace|Aztec Leader taken prisoner]].<br> <br> <</if>> <</switch>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<switch $Final_Spanish_Players/=6>><<set $Final_Spanish_Points=$factions["Spaniards"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$Final_Spanish_Players>><</link>>. <br> <br> <<else>> You watch as <<print $Span_Leader>> raises his sword and [[strikes the final blow|Battle Outcome Spaniards Versus Tlaxcalans 2]].<br> <br> <</if>> <<case "Tlaxcalans">> <<if $Tlax_Leader is $role>> You raise your macuahuitl and <<link "strike the final blow" "Battle Outcome Spaniards Versus Tlaxcalans 2">><<set $Final_Tlaxcalan_Players=$users["Xicotencatl_Elder"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Elder"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Elder"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Younger"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Younger"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Younger"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Maxixcatl"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Maxixcatl"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Maxixcatl"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]>><<set $Final_Tlaxcalan_Players/=3>><<set $Final_Tlaxcalan_Points=$factions["Tlaxcalans"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$Final_Tlaxcalan_Players>><</link>>. <br> <br> <<else>> You watch as <<print $Tlax_Leader>> raises his macuahuitl and [[strikes the final blow|Battle Outcome Spaniards Versus Tlaxcalans 2]].<br> <br> <</if>> <</switch>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> You wake to the smell of fresh tortillas and the chatter of Nahuatl outside your door. Just as you hoped, you are back in Tenochtitlán. And just like every time before, you wake with a clear awareness of your situation. <br> <br> <<switch $users[$role]["faction"]>> <<case "Spaniards">> <b>Your current leader is <<print $Span_Leader>>.</b><br> <br> Six months have passed since you arrived in the city. For six months, you have been a guest of <<print $Aztec_Leader>>, but with every day that passes you feel less like a guest and more like a prisoner. You feel eyes upon you everywhere you go. The Emperor has assured you of your safety and has never shown you anything less than respect, but you don't trust him. You've lain awake every night for weeks, as the nagging dread that lingers at the back of your mind during the day takes over your thoughts.<br> <br> You rouse yourself out of bed and prepare for another day of wondering and waiting, thinking about how you might force <<print $Aztec_Leader>>'s hand. <br> <br> Suddenly, [[a messenger arrives at your lodgings|Cortes gets called to the coast]].<br> <br> <<case "Aztecs">> <b>Your current leader is <<print $Aztec_Leader>>.</b><br> <br> Six months have passed since the strangers arrived in your city. For six months, you have treated them as guests and watched their every move. They have marveled at your city, recoiled in horror at your temples, and beseeched you to worship their god instead. Strange creatures, these bearded men and their slave woman. You don't trust them. Nobody does. For many moons, you have been weighing your options, carefully plotting the best way to remove them from your city--permanently.<br> <br> As you begin to prepare for your day, you hear word that the Spaniards have received a message. [[This could be just what you need|Cortes gets called to the coast]].<br> <br> <<case "Tlaxcalans">> <b>Your current leader is <<print $Tlax_Leader>>.</b><br> <br> Six months have passed since you arrived in the city. For six months, you have been a guest of <<print $Aztec_Leader>>, but with every day that passes you feel less like a guest and more like a prisoner. You feel eyes upon you everywhere you go and you have been kept away from the Spaniards, relegated to the periphery of the city. Nonetheless, you have taken advantage of your stay to carefully gather supplies that you will take back to Tlaxcala. You have spent countless hours in the market and you have everything you could possibly need. You grow increasingly anxious by the day, wondering if all is well at home. <br> <br> As you begin to prepare for your day, you hear word that the Spaniards have received a message. [[Could this be your ticket home|Cortes gets called to the coast]]?<br> <br> <</switch>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> You wake to find yourself back in the library, sprawled across the comfy chair. You missed dinner, but somehow your belly feels strangely full. You swear you can still taste the pulque on your lips, but that can't possibly be true... can it? <br> <br> You look at the stack of papers on the floor, and, sure enough, there's your latest history assignment, complete and ready to hand in. Buoyed by the knowledge that another A grade is coming your way, you pack up your things and head home. <br> <br> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> You slowly pull yourself awake. It takes real effort, you were sleeping so deeply. You're confused, there is nothing worse than waking up mid-dream. <br> <br> What is that noise? Nothing makes sense...<br> <br> You shake your head and catch sight of something glowing on the table next to you. <br> <br> Your phone. It is full of texts from your friends. Where have you been? Is your history assignment done?<br> <br> Your heart starts to race. You look around the room. The library! Your assignment! You grab your phone from the table next to you, class starts in just an hour! What are you going to do? <br> <br> It all comes flooding back. That dream was weird, so realistic, but you came here to get your history paper done. And now you've lost the whole night!<br> <br> You start to gather up your things frantically, praying that somehow you'll find the time to complete the assignment. You knock the pile of books off the little side table next to you, and a neatly stapled stack of paper floats gently to the floor. <br> <br> You grab it, you look, you start reading. Your history assignment, it is done! Did you complete it before you fell asleep? You read more. This is good, like really good! You wrote this? You are pretty sure you are getting an A!<br> <br> You take a deep breath, you gather your things up calmly. You can't believe it. You don't remember writing this brilliant paper, but here it is, done. And you feel rested, if a bit disoriented. Everything is going to be alright after all! You text your friends. You'll meet them in class.<br> <br> As you close the door of the weird little room behind you, you know <<link "you'll be back" "return to the library_no door">><<set $Tlaxcalans_currentMap=1000>><<set $Aztecs_currentMap=1000>><<set $Spaniards_currentMap=1000>><</link>>. You've done your best work here, and that big red chair is so cozy!<br> <br> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> You wake from a fitful sleep, disturbed by dreams of battle. When you open your eyes, you are surprised to find that you're not on the battlefield but back in the library once again. <br> <br> You know the drill by now and you look immediately to the pile of papers that lies at your feet. Sure enough, sitting on top of the stack is your history assignment, finished. You read it over and can't believe your luck. This one might be even better than the last!<br> <br> You check your phone and see you still have plenty of time before class starts, so you make your way home. You smell alright, but you feel like you've never needed a shower so badly in your life!<br> <br> All the way home, you marvel at your luck and ignore the nagging feeling at the back of your mind that wonders if it's okay to hand in this assignment that you don't remember writing. You must have written it though, right? There's no other explanation. <br> <br> You decide that you'll hand the assignment in this time and <<link "go back later to investigate" "return to the library_no door">><<set $Tlaxcalans_currentMap=1000>><<set $Aztecs_currentMap=1000>><<set $Spaniards_currentMap=1000>><</link>>.<br> <br> <</liveblock>>If you are to survive your journey, you will need to stop first at the place of flowers. Be careful as you seek what you came for, as you could easily get stuck in the mud.<br> <br> <<switch $users[$role]["faction"]>> <<case "Aztecs">> <<if $Quest_Leader_A is $role>> This city is <<textbox "$Xochimilco_Ans_A" "">><br> <br> <<link "Submit your answer" "Xochimilco 2">><</link>><br> <br> <<elseif $Quest_Leader_A isnot $role>> <<print $Quest_Leader_A>> must answer this question. You couldn't concentrate on anything because all you could think about was that mysterious room and the history assignment you don't remember writing. I mean, you must have written it, right? You feel a little guilty about handing it in, but you decide not to think too hard about that.<br> <br> It's now late afternoon and you're finally free for the day. You hurry back to the library, excited to revisit the mystery room and its big comfy chair. You hope that if you look closely, you'll find some clue to what happened...some indication that you really did write that killer paper.<br> <br> You arrive on the top floor and round the corner but you can't find the door! You swear this is exactly where you found it before, but it's not here. Confused, you scour every corner of the library to no avail. The door is nowhere to be found. You head home feeling deeply unsettled.<br> <br> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<print $factions["Aztecs"]["stats"]["Strength"]>><br> <br> cut Aztec Strength in half<br> <br> <<link "Halve Aztec outcome">><<set $Final_Spanish_Players=$users["Cortes"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Cortes"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Cortes"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Alvarado"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Alvarado"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Alvarado"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Aguilar"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Aguilar"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Aguilar"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Marina"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Marina"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Marina"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Garrido"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Garrido"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Garrido"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Olid"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Olid"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Olid"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]>><<set outcome">><<set $Final_Tlaxcalan_Players=$users["Xicotencatl_Elder"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Elder"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Elder"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Younger"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Younger"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Xicotencatl_Younger"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]+$users["Maxixcatl"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$users["Maxixcatl"]["stats"]["Loyalty"]+$users["Maxixcatl"]["stats"]["Wisdom"]>><<set $Final_Tlaxcalan_Players/=3>><<set $Final_Tlaxcalan_Points=$factions["Tlaxcalans"]["stats"]["Strength"]+$Final_Tlaxcalan_Players>><</link>>. <br> <br> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<print $factions["Aztecs"]["stats"]["Strength"]>><br> <br> <<print $Final_Aztec_Points>><br> <br> <<print $Final_Spanish_Points>><br> <br> <<print $Final_Tlaxcalan_Points>><br> <br> [[test equations]]<br> <br> [[Dashboard]]<br> <br> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<switch $role>> <<case "Aztec_Priest">> Upon hearing the news, you reflect upon a series of omens that have occurred in recent years. <br> <br> First, a fiery comet appeared in the sky and showed itself for a full year.<br> <br> Second, a fire consumed the Temple of Huitzilopochtli that could not be put out. When the residents of Tenochtitlán threw water upon the fire, it only grew stronger.<br> <br> Third, lightning struck the Temple of Xiuhteuctli, despite the fact that it was barely raining.<br> <br> Fourth, a comet fell from the sky in the middle of the day. The comet had three tails and where they were seen, they made a great noise, like the sound of rattles.<br> <br> Fifth, the waters of Lake Texcoco set fire, boiling and bubbling, destroying houses along the shore.<br> <br> Sixth, at night, a woman could be heard crying out, “O my children, we are about to go forever.” “O my children, where am I to take you?”<br> <br> Seventh, the residents of Lake Texcoco caught a strange bird, like a crane. Its skull was deformed and reflected the stars, like a mirror. When Moctezuma peered into the mirror, he saw a group of men marching, outfitted for war and carried on the backs of deer.<br> <br> Eighth, strange creatures appeared in the city, creatures with two heads but only one body. When they were taken to Moctezuma, he looked upon them and they disappeared.<br> <br> What could these omens possibly mean? It is up to you to help Moctezuma find meaning in these signs. The future of the empire could be at stake. <br> <br> Go to your site and create a new page titled “Omens.” Here, you will work with Moctezuma to present your interpretation to the rest of your people. What meaning can you draw from these strange signs? What do they mean for the future? How can you convey their meaning?<br> <br> It is not yet time to tell your people what all of this means, but that time will come soon. For now, pay close attention to events as they unfold. You are certain that the arrival of the foreigners is key to interpreting these strange signs. <br> <br> <<if $Tl_Omens is "Yes">> <b>As you contemplate the meaning of the signs, you receive some surprising news. It seems that a delegation of Tlaxcalans, your sworn enemies, have arrived in Tenochtitlán to seek an audience with Moctezuma. He invites you to accompany him [[to the meeting|Tlaxcalans and Aztecs meet]].</b><br> <br> <<elseif $Tl_Omens is "Nothing" or "Spies">> You wait anxiously for the delegation to return with [[news from the coast|Aztecs Return to Tenochtitlan to report]].<br> <br> <<elseif $Tl_Omens eq "" or ndef $Tl_Omens>> You contemplate the omens as you wait for new developments. <br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"><br> <br> You are waiting for the Tlaxcalan team to make a decision.<br> <br> <</if>> <<case "Moctezuma">> Upon hearing the news, you reflect upon a series of omens that have occurred in recent years. <br> <br> First, a fiery comet appeared in the sky and showed itself for a full year.<br> <br> Second, a fire consumed the Temple of Huitzilopochtli that could not be put out. When the residents of Tenochtitlán threw water upon the fire, it only grew stronger.<br> <br> Third, lightning struck the Temple of Xiuhteuctli, despite the fact that it was barely raining.<br> <br> Fourth, a comet fell from the sky in the middle of the day. The comet had three tails and where they were seen, they made a great noise, like the sound of rattles.<br> <br> Fifth, the waters of Lake Texcoco set fire, boiling and bubbling, destroying houses along the shore.<br> <br> Sixth, at night, a woman could be heard crying out, “O my children, we are about to go forever.” “O my children, where am I to take you?”<br> <br> Seventh, the residents of Lake Texcoco caught a strange bird, like a crane. Its skull was deformed and reflected the stars, like a mirror. When you peered into the mirror, you saw a group of men marching, outfitted for war and carried on the backs of deer.<br> <br> Eighth, strange creatures appeared in the city, creatures with two heads but only one body. When they were brought to you, you looked upon them and they disappeared.<br> <br> What could these omens possibly mean? You consult with your priest to find meaning in these signs. The future of the empire could be at stake. <br> <br> Meet with the priest and visit his site, where you will create a new page titled “Omens.” Here, you will work together to present your interpretation to the rest of your people. What meaning can you draw from these strange signs? What do they mean for the future? How can you convey their meaning? <br> <br> It is not yet time to tell your people what all of this means, but that time will come soon. For now, pay close attention to events as they unfold. You are certain that the arrival of the foreigners is key to interpreting these strange signs. <br> <br> <<if $Tl_Omens is "Yes">> <b>As you contemplate the meaning of the signs, you receive some surprising news. It seems that a delegation of Tlaxcalans, your sworn enemies, have arrived in Tenochtitlán and they wish to speak with you. You take your priest with you as you go to [[hear what they have to say|Tlaxcalans and Aztecs meet]].</b><br> <br> <<elseif $Tl_Omens is "Nothing" or "Spies">> You wait anxiously for the delegation to return with [[news from the coast|Aztecs Return to Tenochtitlan to report]].<br> <br> <<elseif $Tl_Omens eq "" or ndef $Tl_Omens>> You contemplate the omens as you wait for new developments.<br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"><br> <br> You are waiting for the Tlaxcalan team to make a decision.<br> <br> <</if>> <</switch>> <</liveblock>>You awake with a start, unsure of your surroundings. Your heart is racing, and you're disoriented. The library! How did you get back here? This wasn't supposed to happen now! Your finished assignment lays at your feet, but you hardly care. Desperate to go back, you close your eyes and will yourself to go to sleep. It doesn't work. You need to know what's going to happen! You're so frustrated you could scream. <br> <br> After an hour, you accept defeat and leave. You swing by your history teacher's office on the way, handing in your assignment. You're sure she's going to give you another A, but that's the last thing [[on your mind at this point|A Desperate Return to the Library]].<br> <br>You thought you were so clever when you got your last assignment early, but now you're desperate to get back to Tenochtitlán and there's nothing to hand in. <br> <br> All you can think about is getting back into the mysterious room and waking up in Mexico. You're not sleeping. You can hardly pay attention in class. You go to the library every day for two weeks, even though you know you won't see the door. And you don't. The staff are starting to look at you funny, and you're pretty sure the security guard was following you last time you were there. You feel like you're losing your mind, but all you can do is wait. And wait. And wait.<br> <br><<liveblock>> The day your history teacher hands out your next assignment, you can barely contain your excitement. You don't even wait for class to end before running out of class and heading to the library. You climb the stairs, round the corner, and there it is!<br> <br> <<if $Tlax_Final_Dec eq "Span">> As you sink into the chair, your adrenaline is pumping so hard you doubt you'll be able to fall asleep. The chair works its magic within seconds though, <<switch $users[$role]["faction"]>> <<case "Aztecs">> <<if $role is $Aztec_Leader>> <<if $Az_Ld_Dead is "Yes">> and you immediately drift [[into a deep slumber|Final Battle Purgatory]].<br> <br> <<else>> and you immediately drift <<link "into a deep slumber" "Final Battle 1">><</link>>.<br> <br> <</if>> <<else>> and you immediately drift <<link "into a deep slumber" "Final Battle 1">><</link>>.<br> <br> <</if>> <<case "Spaniards">> <<if $role is "Cortes">> <<if $Cortes_Dead is "Yes">> and you immediately drift [[into a deep slumber|Final Battle Purgatory]].<br> <br> <<else>> and you immediately drift <<link "into a deep slumber" "Final Battle 1">><</link>>.<br> <br> <</if>> <<else>> and you immediately drift <<link "into a deep slumber" "Final Battle 1">><</link>>.<br> <br> <</if>> <<case "Tlaxcalans">> and you immediately drift <<link "into a deep slumber" "Final Battle 1">><</link>>.<br> <br> <</switch>> <<elseif $Tlax_Final_Dec eq "Alone">> As you sink into the chair, your adrenaline is pumping so hard you doubt you'll be able to fall asleep. A pair of spies just arrived in the village with news. <br> <br> The two sides are currently at war, and it's unlike anything your people have ever seen. It's not yet clear who will win. You wait anxiously.<br> <br> You wait for your options to become clear.<br> <br> The Spaniards and Aztecs must battle it out.<br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"> <br> <<elseif $Span_Decision is "Peace" and $Aztec_Decision is "Peace">> <<if $role is $Tlax_Leader>> The Spaniards and the Aztecs have made peace! They've been keeping close watch and now there is news to report! It seems there has been a great battle and the Spaniards emerged victorious! The Mexica defeat was catastrophic. It seems clear that Huitzilopochtli has abandoned them.<br> <br> But what will this mean for you? What is your best way forward? Should you propose peace and try to salvage your relationship with the Spaniards? Or is now the chance to make your move, to be the last ones standing and to rule over the once powerful Aztec Empire yourselves?<br> <br> Go to the Tlaxcalan discussion board and weigh your options. You have two choices:<br> <br> <b>Option 1:</b> Offer to make peace with the Spaniards.<br> <br> <b>Option 2:</b> Launch a surprise attack and put an end to the foreigners, once and for all.<br> <br> <<if ndef $Tlax_Span_Peace or $Tlax_Span_Peace eq "">> When you have agreed on the best course of action, <<print $Tlax_Leader>> will input your decision. You may then carry on.<br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"> <br> You must wait for <<print $Tlax_Leader>> to input your decision.<br> <br> <<elseif $Tlax_Span_Peace is "Yes">> You have decided to approach the Spaniards [[in peace with an outstretched hand|Tlaxcala Does Nothing and Makes a Peace Treaty with Spanish Winners]].<br> <br> <<elseif $Tlax_Span_Peace is "No">> You have decided to seize on this moment of weakness and attack the [[Spaniards|Final Battle 1]].<br> <br> <</if>> <</if>> <<elseif $Aztec_Game > $Span_Game>> <<if $role is $Tlax_Leader>> After the Spaniards made their departure, your spies followed close behind. They've been keeping close watch and now there is news to report! It seems there has been a great battle and the Mexica emerged victorious! So great was their victory that the foreign enemies are no more. Those who survived the battle were offered up to Huitzilopochtli, who will surely reward the victors for such a valuable gift.<br> <br> You are now faced with a decision. Has this experience changed your feelings about your archenemies? Or does the hatred of a thousand suns still consume you? <br> <br> Go to the Tlaxcalan discussion board and weigh your options. You have two choices:<br> <br> <b>Option 1:</b> <<link "Offer to make peace with the Mexica" "Tlaxcala Does Nothing and Makes a Peace Treaty with the Aztec Winners">><<set $Tlax_Az_Peace="Yes">><<set $Tlax_Decision = "Peace">><</link>>.<br> <br> <b>Option 2:</b> <<link "Launch a surprise attack on Tenochtitlán and put an end to your enemies, once and for all" "Final Battle 1">><<set $Tlax_Az_Peace="No">><</link>>.<br> <br> When you have agreed on the best course of action, input your decision here. You may then carry on.<br> <br> <<else>> After the Spaniards made their departure, your spies followed close behind. They've been keeping close watch and now there is news to report! It seems there has been a great battle and the Mexica emerged victorious! So great was their victory that the foreign enemies are no more. Those who survived the battle were offered up to Huitzilopochtli, who will surely reward the victors for such a valuable gift.<br> <br> You are now faced with a decision. Has this experience changed your feelings about your archenemies? Or does the hatred of a thousand suns still consume you? <br> <br> Go to the Tlaxcalan discussion board and weigh your options. You may then [[carry on|Tlaxcala Does Nothing and Makes a Peace Treaty with the Aztec Winners]].<br> <br> <<elseif $Tlax_Az_Peace is "No">> You have decided to seize on this moment of weakness and attack the [[Aztecs| Final Battle 1]].<br> <br> <</if>> <</if>> <</if>> <</if>> <</switch>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> <<set _Span_Final = setup.getTotalChoices ("Span_Final")>> <<set _Span_Tot_Play = setup.getTotalChoices("Span_Tot_Play")>> <<set _Aztec_Final = setup.getTotalChoices ("Aztec_Final")>> <<set _Aztec_Tot_Play = setup.getTotalChoices("Aztec_Tot_Play")>> <<set _Tlax_Final = setup.getTotalChoices ("Aztec_Final")>> <<set _Tlax_Tot_Play = setup.getTotalChoices("Aztec_Tot_Play")>> <<set _Aztec_Priest_Final = setup.getTotalChoices("Aztec_Priest_Final")>> <<set _Cacamatzin_Final = setup.getTotalChoices("Cacamatzin_Final")>> <<set _Cuauhtemoc_Final = setup.getTotalChoices("Cuauhtemoc_Final")>> <<set _Moctezuma_Final = setup.getTotalChoices("Moctezuma_Final")>> <<set _Pochteca_Final = setup.getTotalChoices("Pochteca_Final")>> <<set _Tlacaelel_Final = setup.getTotalChoices("Tlacaelel_Final")>> <<if ndef $Aztec_End>> <<set $Aztec_End= 0>> <</if>> <<if ndef $Span_End>> <<set $Span_End= 0>> <</if>> <<if ndef $Tlax_End>> <<set $Tlax_End= 0>> <</if>> The fog of war begins to clear. You look around to survey the scene. <br> <br> Below is a tally of all the individual points for each member of your faction: strength, wisdom, and loyalty combined. The total of each team member will appear as they join you.<br> <br> <<switch $users[$role]["faction"]>> <<case "Aztecs">> <b>Aztecs</b><br> <<if $Aztec_Priest_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Aztec_Priest_Act is "Yes">> Aztec Priest Total Points: <<print $Aztec_Priest_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Cacamatzin_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Cacamatzin_Act is "Yes">> Cacamatzin Total Points: <<print $Cacamatzin_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Cuauhtemoc_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Cuauhtemoc_Act is "Yes">> Cuauhtemoc Total Points: <<print $Cuauhtemoc_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Moctezuma_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Moctezuma_Act is "Yes">> Moctezuma Total Points: <<print $Moctezuma_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Pochteca_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Pochteca_Act is "Yes">> Pochteca Total Points: <<print $Pochteca_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Tlacaelel_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Tlacaelel_Act is "Yes">> Tlacaelel Total Points: <<print $Tlacaelel_Final>><br> <</if>> Current Aztec Leader: <<print $New_Aztec_Leader>><br> Aztec Team Strength: <<print $factions["Aztecs"]["stats"]["Strength"]>><br> Aztec Players who have struck their final blow: <<print _Aztec_Final>><br> Total Aztec Players in Game: <<print _Aztec_Tot_Play>><br> <br> <<switch $role>> <<case "Tlacaelel">> <<if $role is $New_Aztec_Leader>> <b><<print $role>>, the battle is over. Watch the count below as you wait for others to arrive. When all members of your faction have added their points, your leader will finalize the score.<br> <br> Your final score is the total of all individual player points plus your team strength points. The total will be divided by the number of players on your team...dead or alive.<br> <br> <<switch $users[$role]["faction"]>> <<case "Aztecs">> <b>Aztecs</b><br> <b>Spaniards</b><br> <<if $Aztec_Priest_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Aztec_Priest_Act is "Yes">> Aztec Priest Total Points: <<print $Aztec_Priest_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Cacamatzin_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Cacamatzin_Act is "Yes">> Cacamatzin Total Points: <<print $Cacamatzin_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Cuauhtemoc_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Cuauhtemoc_Act is "Yes">> Cuauhtemoc Total Points: <<print $Cuauhtemoc_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Moctezuma_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Moctezuma_Act is "Yes">> Moctezuma Total Points: <<print $Moctezuma_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Pochteca_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Pochteca_Act is "Yes">> Pochteca Total Points: <<print $Pochteca_Final>><br> <</if>> <<if $Tlacaelel_Act is "No">> <<elseif $Tlacaelel_Act is "Yes">> Tlacaelel Total Points: <<print $Tlacaelel_Final>><br> <</if>> Aztec Team Strength: <<print $factions["Aztecs"]["stats"]["Strength"]>><br> Aztec Players who have struck their final blow: <<print _Aztec_Final>><br> Total Aztec Players in Game: <<print _Aztec_Tot_Play>><br> Aztec Players Total Final: <<print $Aztec_End>><br> <br> <<if $Az_Ld_Dead is "Yes">> <<if _Aztec_Final < _Aztec_Tot_Play - 1>> You wait for the haze of war to clear.<br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"> <br> You must wait until all active Aztec Players have joined.<br><br> <<else>> <<if $role is $New_Aztec_Leader>> <<if $Aztec_Game_Over is "No">> <b>Aztec Final Score: <<print $Aztec_Game>></b><br> Calculate <<link "Final Score" "Final Battle 3">><<set $Aztec_Game = $Aztec_End / _Aztec_Tot_Play>><<set $Aztec_Game_Over = "Yes">><</link>><br> <br> <<elseif $Aztec_Game_Over is "Yes">> <b>Aztec Final Score: <<print $Aztec_Game>></b><br> You now have your final score. You may [[contine on to decide what to do about it|After the Final Battle]]. <</if>> <<else>> <<if $Aztec_Game_Over is "No">> You must wait for your leader to calculate your final score.<br> <br> <b>Aztec Final Score: <<print $Aztec_Game>></b><br> <<elseif $Aztec_Game_Over is "Yes">> <b>Aztec Final Score: <<print $Aztec_Game>></b><br> You now have your final score. You may [[contine on to decide what to do about it|After the Final Battle]]. <</if>> <</if>> <</if>> <<else>> <<if _Aztec_Final < _Aztec_Tot_Play>> You wait for the haze of war to clear.<br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"> <br> You must wait until all Aztec Players have joined.<br><br> <<else>> <<if $role is $New_Aztec_Leader>> <<if $Aztec_Game_Over is "No">> <b>Aztec Final Score: <<print $Aztec_Game>></b><br> Calculate <<link "Final Score" "Final Battle 3">><<set $Aztec_Game = $Aztec_End / _Aztec_Tot_Play>><<set $Aztec_Game_Over = "Yes">><</link>><br> <br> <<elseif $Aztec_Game_Over is "Yes">> <b>Aztec Final Score: <<print $Aztec_Game>></b><br> You now have your final score. You may [[continue on to decide what to do about it|After the Final Battle]]. <</if>> <<else>> <<if $Aztec_Game_Over is "No">> You must wait for your leader to calculate your final score.<br> <br> <b>Aztec Final Score: <<print $Aztec_Game>></b><br> <<elseif $Aztec_Game_Over is "Yes">> <b>Aztec Final Score: <<print $Aztec_Game>></b><br> You now have your final score. This is the moment you've been waiting for. You must know how the story ends! Slowly you open your eyes and see before you...the library. <br> <br> No! This can't be right! You need to get back to Tenochtitlán! You close your eyes, desperate to fall asleep and return, but to no avail. You lean back in the chair, willing it to happen.<br> <br> It's only when you finally give up and accept defeat that you notice something alarming: there's no door. Panicked, you pound on the wall with your fists, yelling at the top of your lungs for anyone to hear, but no one does. Then you remember that this is the 21st century and you grab your phone to call for help, but the battery is dead.<br> <br> You pick up your assignment and wonder how much time you have until it's due. You don't even know what time it is. The ancient clock on the wall says it's 3:45, but is it even right? And is it the middle of the afternoon or the middle of the night? Will you ever get out of here? You collapse into the chair as the clock ticks loudly at your back. Tick...tick...tick...<br> <br><br> <<switch $users[$role]["faction"]>> <<case "Aztecs">> <<if $Aztec_Decision is "No">> All you can do is wait, but for how long...<br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"> <br> <br> <<elseif $Aztec_Decision is "Peace" or $Aztec_Decision is "War">> You finally manage to [[fall back asleep|The End]]<br> <br> <</if>> <<case "Spaniards">> <<if $Span_Decision is "No">> All you can do is wait, but for how long...<br> <br> <img src="Twine/images/Stop_1.png" style="width:60%; margin:auto; display:block;"> <br> <br> <<elseif $Span_Decision is "Peace" or $Span_Decision is "War">> You finally manage to [[fall back asleep|The End]]<br> <br> <</if>> <</switch>> <</liveblock>>Add One Point to Spanish Strength: <<link "plus one point" "6 Reset for Testing Act 5">><<set $factions["Spaniards"]["stats"]["Strength"]+=1>><</link>><br> <br> Add One Point to Aztec Strength: <<link "plus one point" "6 Reset for Testing Act 5">><<set $factions["Aztecs"]["stats"]["Strength"]+=1>><</link>><br> <br> Add One Point to Tlaxcalan Strength: <<link "plus one point" "6 Reset for Testing Act 5">><<set $factions["Tlaxcalans"]["stats"]["Strength"]+=1>><</link>><br> <br> The Tlaxcalan end of game decision is: <br> <br> <<if ndef $Tlax_Final_Dec or $Tlax_Final_Dec is "O">> There is no record of a Tlaxcalan Decision.<br> <br> <<elseif $Tlax_Final_Dec is "Span">> The Tlaxcalans chose to make an alliance with the Spaniards and attack the Aztecs together.<br> <br> <<elseif $Tlax_Final_Dec is "AttackSpan">> The Tlaxcalans chose to attack the Spaniards in Tlaxcala. <<elseif $Tlax_Final_Dec is "Alone">> The Tlaxcalans chose to do nothing and standby to see what happens between Spaniards and Aztecs.<br> <br> <</if>> Reset the Tlaxcalan End of Game Decision. <br> $Moctezuma_Final = 0>><<set $Tlacaelel_Final = 0>><<set $Cuauhtemoc_Final = 0>><<set $Cacamatzin_Final = 0>><<set $Aztec_Priest_Final = 0>><<set $Pochteca_Final = 0>><<set $Aztec_Final = 0>><<set Select a passage from your passage history above to review it. The passages are in order of how you played them. <<script>> requestAnimationFrame(() => { $(".passageButton").on("click", function() { $(".passageButton.selectedPassageButton").removeClass("selectedPassageButton"); $(this).addClass("selectedPassageButton"); let passageButtonId = $(this).attr("data-passageName"); let passage_text = State.getVar(`$passageHistory["${passageButtonId}"]`); $("#selectedPassageTextContainer").html(passage_text); }); $("#chat-switch .macro-button").on("click", function() { $("#chat-switch .selectedChatButton").removeClass("selectedChatButton"); $(this).addClass("selectedChatButton"); }); if (State.getVar("$users")[State.getVar("$role")].currentChat == "chat") { $("#chat-switch .macro-button:nth-child(1)").addClass("selectedChatButton"); } else { $("#chat-switch .macro-button:nth-child(2)").addClass("selectedChatButton"); } }); <</script>> </div> </div> /* Use this as a template to make side passages */<<liveblock>> Side passage example 1 /* Put link to next passage */ <<link "Next passage (2)" "Side Passage Example 2">><</link>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> Side passage example 2 /* Put link to next passage */ <<link "Next passage (final)" "Side Passage Example Final">><</link>> <</liveblock>><<liveblock>> Side passage example Final <<print $users[$role]["sidePassageReturn"]>> /* Put this link line at the end of every side passage series */ /* <<link "Back to main passage" $users[$role]["sidePassageReturn"]>><</link>> */ <</liveblock>> /* Use this to send users to side passages */
